First time player after waiting for the Steam release and after 2 hours I can say it is a refreshing, immersive experience. The tutorial is easy going and lets you go at your own pace, giving you a island to explore, a ship and the basic information/equipment for you to start your own adventure, creating your own tricks to form a personal pirate experience right from the get go.

Setting sail from tutorial island and going through the mini gauntlet, teasing you on what lays ahead, it's time for you to set sail on the open sea of thieves with the game mode 'Adventure'. This is the main game mode where you will be in a big open world with PVE (Player vs Environment) elements and other players that allows PVP (Player vs Player), which can create some interesting, exciting engagements that change the pace of adventures.

Spawning on one of many 'hub' islands you are greeted with some buildings that offer different cosmetics for weapons, clothes and your ship which can be purchased with gold that you earn from doing 'voyages' which are basically 'quests' that are also on the 'hub' island. 

After picking from three choices of voyages on 'hub' island, which are split into treasure hunting, bounty hunting and doing merchant runs which all offer different challenges and rewards. 

At first you will feel a bit lost and overwhelmed but with time you will become adjusted to the style of play and will be raiding islands and looting treasure chests in plenty of time, or doing merchant runs or just simply fishing. 

Play the pirate life you've always wanted.

(The 3rd party Xbox live account is a bit annoying but once setup it is simple as clicking play and loading in) 

P.S. Make sure you are ONLINE on Steam to log in, you cannot load the game as invisible or offline since it won't load you in.

Sea of Thieves, two years later, is a great pirate sandbox. At launch the game was pretty light on content, especially for its $60 price tag. Now, given all the updates it's had and the reduced price, I can't recommend the game enough. 300+ hours on MS Store, Pirate Legend with Athena 7 as of June 3rd, 2020. This game is one of the best social experiences I've had in a game. Every encounter with players is different from the last, friend or foe; I've met a ton of friends in this game, and just a ton of people in general, from focused and skilled to eccentric but incredibly funny. The great content in this game, as well as the incredible presentation graphics and sound-wise, only add to this experience.

I bought it for $20 on MS Store, and I bought it for $40 here on Steam. Absolutely no regrets.

I've played Sea of Thieves for over 100 hours on the Microsoft Store, here is my review.

OVERVIEW:
This is by far one of the best Sandbox multiplayer games on the market. If you have ever wanted to live out your pirate life fantasy, this the absolute best way to go about it. With a beautiful cartoony art style and a playstyle fit for every type of sandbox gamer out there, you are sure to find something to love out there on the High Seas.

WHO MADE SEA OF THIEVES?
Sea of Thieves was made by Rare, yes that Rare. The same company that brought you Donkey Kong Country/64, Banjo-Kazooie, Battletoads, Viva Pinata, Conkers Bad Fur Day and many other classic games going back as far as the original Nintendo Entertainment System. Rare is currently owned by Microsoft.

NUMBER OF PLAYERS?
Sea of Thieves can be played solo or with a party of up to 4 players working together to control a single ship. There are 3 different ships available. Solo players and most duo-players will be using an up to 2-player Sloop. Crews of 3 can use the larger 3-player Brigintine ship. And crews of 4 will use the largest ship, the Galleon. However you can always pilot a larger ship than your crew can handle, it just means an increased amount of difficulty. A larger ship means there is more to do when sailing and battling as well as it takes more players to successfully maneuver your floating base of operations.

AS A NEW PLAYER WILL I BE CRUSHED BY PLAYERS WITH BETTER GEAR?
Absolutely not. When you first log into the game you have access to all of the tools and weapons that every single other player has. Everything that is unlocked in the game is purely cosmetic. The only factor that matters in fights with other players is skill.

WHAT KIND OF PLAYSTYLES ARE THERE?
The different playstyles are actually tied to the 5 main factions that you will be gaining Reputation with throughout the game. You'll accept quests from these factions at outposts that will send you off in different directions to collect or deliver various items for them all throughout the seas to get experience and level the faction. Leveling a faction unlocks different gear skins, clothing options and ship skins that allow you to customize your pirate to your liking. Here is a brief overview of every faction:

- The Gold Hoarders give you Treasure maps and riddles that send you off to find buried treasure for them, of which you get a nice cut of the coin once you turn it in to them. Good for the adventurous player that likes to Explore Islands.

- The Order of Souls tasks you with going to specific locations to battle AI skeletons and retrieve their skulls for rewards. Good for the player that likes to fight PvE (player versus environment) baddies.

- The Merchant Alliance tasks you with delivering cargo or animals to specific islands within a certain timeframe. Good for those that like to play the role of delivery boy (most players honestly don't though).

- The Hunter's Call is for players who enjoy Fishing and Cooking. Bring them the meat of what you have found and they will reward you with unique item sets as well as coin. (Always cook your meat before you sell it as it will be worth more gold/Rep)

- The Reaper's Bones is the faction for players who love to PvP. They accept any and all loot that you wanna give them. However there is only one turn-in location on the map, so fights are sure to ensue.

For all the above factions you can also choose to become an Emissary for them. Being an Emissary attaches the faction's flag to your ship which you can level up in your session to add an ever increasing multiplier to the goods that you turn in for that faction. However be warned... Reaper's Bones Emissary factions will be looking to sink your ship and collect your Emissary flag and turn it in to their hideout for great rewards (if there are any Reaper's Bones Emissaries on the map they will show up on all other player's maps).

There is also an Arena PvP Mode that takes place on a separate map with it's own faction to level called The Sea Dogs.

- The 7th and final faction is Athena's Fortune (see next section)

IS THERE AN ENDGAME?
Yes and no. Everything you unlock in the game is cosmetic, so you won't be hunting for "better" gear in a traditional endgame. However the end goal for most players is to reach the rank of Pirate Legend! There is a 7th faction called Athena's Fortune which is unlocked when you manage to level at least 3 of the other 6 factions to level 50. This unlocks a special hideout only Pirate Legends have access to that have unique cosmetics and voyages to unlock.

IS THERE A STORY MODE?
Yes and no. There are a number of story quests you can go on called Tall Tales. These are stories quests that you can go on to learn more about the world and expand the narrative of the colorful characters who inhabit it. They each take anywhere from 30 minutes to a few hours to complete and can be repeated or paused at certain checkpoints so you can come back to them later. You'll meet interesting characters, solve riddles and battle bosses not seen in the main overworld.

IS THERE MORE TO IT THAN ALL THAT YOU LISTED?
Yes! The activities above are only some of the things that you can choose to do. There are Skeleton Fort Raids that you can take on to unlock an entire cave of treasures! There are Bosses you can run into just while sailing around like the a Ghost Pirate Ship, The Kraken or The Megladon! On top of that there are also monthly events you can take part in for unique time-limited rewards. You could also just look to the horizon and travel without accepting any quest, you will surely bump into something that you can do.

IS GAME DEVELOPMENT COMPLETE?
It is not! Every single month Rare introduces new events to the world which could be either something as small as adding kamikazi skeletons that can now pop out of the ground with lit gunpowder barrels in their hands, to whole new systems (like fishing), new factions, new bosses, new tall tales or more! The game is just over 2 years old now and is a completely different beast than what it was at launch. So much new stuff has been added that it would take me too long to list.

I SEE THAT THERE IS A CASH SHOP. CAN PLAYERS BUY POWER?
There is a cash shop called the Pirate Emporium, however everything in the cash shop is cosmetic only. You can buy; pets, gear skins, ship skins emotes and much much more. This shop is updated often with new products monthly and often has discount sales on certain items. For a $40 game I myself have no problem dropping a little money here every now and then to help support the continued development of the game. I have a black and white cat named "Bandit" and he is my overlord.

FINAL SCORE
I don't really like actually "scoring" games because I feel the score's number diminishes the details. All I have to say is that if you like sandbox games, there isn't any other game like this on the market today. It is a must buy if you love adventure games, multiplayer games or anything having to do with the ocean. I often judge my entertainment purchases based off the number of hours I spend playing the game. For $40 you are absolutely going to get at least 40 hours of entertainment out of this game. 

FINAL THOUGHTS
I must note that the game can be played solo however it is more fun to me when you play with people that you know on Discord. If you don't know of anyone to play with then I recommend trying the Sea of Thieves official discord, there are looking for group channels as well as free chat channels you can use to make some new pirate friends.

I also recommend looking up some beginner's videos as well as Tips and Trick videos on YouTube. There are many techniques to ship battling, sword fighting and more that the game doesn't fully explain.

If you are ever confused by something or don't know what something is used for or what something does then I recommend the Sea of Thieves Gamepedia page (just google it).

There are ways to find others to play with but the game thus far feels very cut throat so in that aspect I think the developers did a great job creating this wild thieving world where everyone is on edge and watching their back.
I advise you buy this if you love co op games and have friends to do so. otherwise you could be in for a world of hurt.

TL|DR - Very fun, beautiful graphics, Best looking water I have ever seen. Fun but simple fighting and the ship mechanics are a blast. Must play with others to avoid being picked on by larger groups. Exploration is fun. The AI that you fight is pretty basic and bland but maybe there is more as you get farther out in the seas. all upgrades are strictly cosmetic. there is no progression system with gear and loot - to a point this is great but it will eventually become an issue as you yearn for more substance and things to work towards besides a simple jacket or hook hand or sail color.

Alright, where do I even begin with this? The game has come such a long way from launch, there is so much to do now and combat between ships is very fleshed out and strategic seeing as you can Board the enemies, destroy masts , set fire on the ship to cause chaos detroy steering wheels and capstans to reduce mobility special cannonballs with unique effects the sky is the limit on how you plan your attack. After that the PVE aspect has also been fleshed out with Emissary flagging ( basically raising a flag for a faction of your choice to get more xp and cash with the risk of being shown to Reapers Bones players ( The PvP oriented faction that primarily gets XP from Stolen loot ) and tall tales which are small adventures with a story. Lastly and most importantly sailing is extremely satisfying in this game even if you arent really doing anything you have fun going from island to island ( At least I do ) and combined with the instruments that play pirate songs the atmosphere is wholesome to say the least.

Do keep in mind that this is Sea of THIEVES, when you see another ship or player always assume they are hostile, Betrayal is as common as the common cold and players will go out of their way to steal your precious booty. We are Pirates above all else after all

TL;DR : If you like Open world games and Pirates and PvP, grab some friends and get on this, You will not regret it

Sea of Thieves/Ineffective Pirates of The Caribbean/Sea of Electric Boogaloo/Pirate Simulator 2020 is 100% my absolute favorite game hands down game set match every single time.

Although my playtime here on steam is very low, my friends and I have easily breached the 100 hour barrier. I am not a pirate lord as we didn't really care.  What we really cared about was being a swashbuckling band of rag-tag pirates sailing the high seas for good laughs and explosions.

This game scratches the EXACT itch I always need a pirate game to scratch:

The melee combat can be a bit wonky, but its simplicity is as advanced as it needs to be. Click to slice, hold to stab. Repetitive, but the number of enemies and absolute chaos taking place in your usual game of Sea of Thieves keeps you locked into the mayhem.

The ship combat is very simple, but with different kinds of cannonballs and the tools available to you keep the combat spontaneous and ALWAYS keeps you on your toes. Mix in the absolute chaos as the ship you're fighting drops kegs or does a drive-by molotoving all while your friends are screaming through the chaos.

I have to talk about the art direction and the music in this game as I find it to be essentially the best part of SoT.  I'll be linking an hour long exploration of the concept art and the designers below. I'd highly recommend it to everyone as it is incredibly interesting. I will now attempt to sum it up:

Sea of Thieves is abundantly unique.  When making this game, they made the art along side the logistics of the game.  The amount of small detail is absolutely astounding.  There is actually a philosophy the designers came up with to properly convey the emotion of this game.  Everything looks used. Everything has little dinks in it. Everything looks like its been used and repaired, giving the entirety of the game a Macgyver repair esq feel to it. Even the floor boards, soaked and shining from the ocean spray, are oblong pieces. Showing that the items you're using, the ship you're on and the places you'll visit have existed and will continue to exist.
Then there's the water in this game. THE WATER. I've never seen a group nail what fantasy ocean should look so perfectly before Rare.  The different colors and reflections. The way the sky colors blend in with the ocean to make stunning sunsets.  The colors of the trees and flora and the characters endlessly strange but happily accepted charm.

And the MUSIC?! I have the OST on my spotify and constantly listen to it when doing just about anything. Music is incredibly important to me in a game like this. You will spend a lot of time listening to the lapping of the waves against your hull, and listening to the shores of the islands.  The background music is in its perfect place as a backdrop. But when you pick up that Hurdy Gurdy while relaxing on your voyage to the next island and you start playing Becalmed...my god it will change you.

The music in this game has no business being this good, and they keep making MORE.

I recommend this game to pretty much every person I can talk to. I've been shouting about this game coming out on steam since I saw the announcement. I've pressured money out of peoples pockets. I've bought this game TWICE. And I intend to make it a gift to friends for however long the servers remain.

Rare made this game into a cornerstone of my time as a gamer.

I've played for many many hours on the Microsoft Store version of the game, and it is an incredible open-ended sandbox experience that continues to get more and more content added as time goes on. But I believe a warning is necessary:

This game is not easy, nor does it hold your hand. While you're playing, it is almost guaranteed that one other person in the world wants to take everything that is yours - even if all you have is your life - and they will do everything in their power to take it. Trust no one, and be ready to fight whoever you encounter, but keep in mind that there are also good souls on the seas, ready to team up and share the wealth. Just don't be surprised if you find yourself at the end of your voyage with a cutlass in your back. All this said, you can often find yourself having whole adventures at sea without encountering another crew, instead simply battling the weather and various monsters ready to claim the unsuspecting pirate.

I wholeheartedly recommend the game, and am excited to see more pirates out on the seas! My recommendation is to build a crew of close friends, go out on adventures, and see what roles people fall into best. I personally tend to do well at managing a crew in the midst of battle, so more often than not I find myself in the position of captain, but a navigator who manages voyages and plots out a course is also a very respectable role, and crews always need members ready to repair the ship and fire on enemies! But most important of all, have fun!

This game RULES. The open seas are beautiful, and the ship mechanics are intuitive and engaging. There are so many things to do, every player has a different expirience. And reaching that oh so sweet Pirate Legend status is extremely satisfying. 

I want to be fair and share cons -
1. The hit reg isnt perfect. (but not near as bad as people on reddit complain about)
2. There ARE bugs (But every game has bugs, and this game is very ambitious)
3. Players can be real salty. Just like the Sea Dogs they are. 
4. You WILL lose hours of progress, but learn from it, don't let it discourage you! 
5. The game doesn't do alot (outside of the maiden voyage) to teach you about your actual goal in the game.

But some  pros - 
1.Ship battles rock and are the best ive played in any game
2. the tall tales though tedious, can be a blast with friends
3. even just doing a FISHING voyage can be a fun way to relax, soak in the sea, and learn the world
4. The game isnt afraid to scare new players, its a mysterious world your dropped into, run towards fear!

Quick Note - I have sunk in at least 950 hours+ on Sea of Thieves before it's debut on steam, making it my most played game outside of the steam ecosystem.I started playing in August of 2019.

I'll do my best to rapidly make some points to inform you whether or not Sea of Thieves is for you, With a section describing the positives and another with what could use improving.

[b]The Good[/b]
[list]
    [*]There is a wide variety of content to do. Sea of Thieves earned a [b]WELL-DESERVED[/b] reputation for being very lackluster at launch, but with consistent content updates and patches Rare has done good on their promise to improve SoT from both a stability and content stance. More on the stability issues later. The actual amount of things to do has more than tripled since launch. This includes Megalodons, Skeleton ships/fleets, emissaries, Fort of the Damned, The entire devil's roar region, Tall tales(a series of campaign style missions), fishing, arena, and various additions to combat including cursed cannonballs, the ability to collapse masts, fire and firebombs, chainshots,  and there is more that I don't remember off the top of my head. This does not include the various monthly events that have happened in the past, which are no longer available. An example of one of these events was during the Smugglers Fortune update, in which a new, highly profitable voyage was available for a month BUT everybody had to go to the same island to dig up their treasure. This lead to a lot of PVP for the month, but events like these were one-off.
    [*]Sea of Thieves is an absolute looker, and the visuals are so pretty and enjoyable to look at. In my opinion Rare has absolutely nailed the look of the world and their visual design. I won't go too deep into it, as the SoT subreddit has more than enough posts of screenshots if you would like to see them.
    [*]Ship combat is really enjoyable, and fairly balanced. There is not many negatives I have to say about ship combat except for one [i]tiny[/i] pet peeve when it comes to raising a mast that has been broken. If a mast get fully damaged it will begin to fall, and you will need to raise it back up and repair it. You have to allow the mast to fall all the way before raising it again. If you catch it as it's falling using the sail ropes, and raise it back up, it will just fall again. A minor pet peeve. Other than that the different attributes of the different types of ships play well, and a good crew can really use their ship's strengths to full effect. 
    [*]SoT is the type of game that can fit most people. Are you the type of person that just wants to pass the time, chillin, playing with friends and talking without really worrying about much? Pop down a gold hoarder voyage or start fishing with the boys. Feeling like you want to hunt down and engage in combat with somebody for no particular reason? Pop the reapers mark and announce to everyone you are here to scrap. Do you enjoy climbing the ranks, gathering money, and unlocking things for your effort? Plenty of that for you too. Whatever the case, remember that this is a pirate game, and while some of the people you meet on the seas might be friendly, In my experience most are not, either out of self defense or aggression. So be sure to remember that.   
[/list]

[b]Progression[/b]
Before I cover some of my gripes, I feel that I should quickly discuss the double-edged progression in SoT. The good thing is that there is no difference from a beginner to a veteran except for skill. The pistol you have at the start does the same damage as the pistol the guy with literal gold skin just killed you with. There are no stats in SoT. The game was designed this way so that everybody has a fair playing ground. The bad news is that there is no progression for weapons or the player. The only progression you earn in this game is cosmetic, and that is it. I bring this up because I feel that there is so much potential for weapon or player progression, like warframe(just not as insane) or deep rock galactic(much more sane). I understand that this allows for a fair fight but I can still imagine what it would be like.

[b]The bad/What needs improving[/b]
[list]
  [*] I have one, and only one MAJOR gripe with Sea of Thieves and that is the hit detection with player guns/swords. This wont really be a problem for many of the PvE factors in Sea of thieves but this flaw can show just how bad it can be during PvP fights. It works well most of the time, but sometimes, you will get a hitmarker meaning the shot landed but NO damage will be dealt. I have seen videos of somebody getting shot, hitmarker and you could see it was an obvious hit 5 TIMES (It takes two with the pistol to kill a full HP player). The fact that I have to question if the game is bugging out or if the other person is hacking somewhat often can really show just how bad it can be sometimes and it should not be this way. This has been an issue for a long time and if it was an easy fix, they would have done it. This issue can make the Arena PvP only gamemode a complete joke sometimes. Swords are much more consistent so I use sword and flintlock all the time. This issue applies to every player gun, and the sword will sometimes have this issue too.
   [*]There have been a variety of bugs that have been out for a while, but it seems as Rare is finally managing to tackle some of these. I won't go into depth but most of these were minor, non-game breaking but annoying bugs such as your player cosmetics not being saved across play sessions. This one was fixed, and most of the other ones I know of as well but I figured I should mention it.
[/list]

TLDR: Game is fun and devs constantly add new things to it. I would recommend it. If this TLDR isnt enough information for you, you have a whole review right above it.

I would say it is an absolutely enjoyable product and worth a purchase.

Quick Edit: I forgot to mention that there ARE micro-transactions in this game but as I stated with progression earlier, It is all cosmetics unique to the pirate emporium (premium currency store). Should this ever change I will change my review accordingly. Should Rare allow an actual advantage to be bought I will change my stance on this game in a heartbeat. The only things of any real value in the emporium are the ability to change your characters face/body and pets. If you really want those, there are rare skeletons that spawn that you can kill for ancient coins. My friend recently got this game and is upset with how her character looks and would to like to reset it without paying. After one of these skeletons, she now has enough to buy the change appearance potion, and pets are obtainable with ether 1 lucky skeleton or two unlucky ones (the values of coin you get are randomized.) From what I have seen you can get anywhere from a dollar to 8 dollars worth of currency depending on your luck with a single skeleton. And for what it's worth, the ancient skeletons are not even the the rarest spawn in the game, but they are up there at number 3. You will eventually find a couple over a long period of time.

Imagine being scared of PVP in a PVP game, lmao.

I can only recommend this game after countless hours of fun with the Windows Store version. The developers are active and they are still adding content regularly even though this game is B2P without a subscription.

This is a giant sandbox of fun and a clear work of passion.
Go for some smaller quests, some grand tales, randomly get attacked by giant mega sharks or sunken ships of pirates past or even other player ships. That´s right, there is always the risk of PvP and that makes this game thrilling. Go for another ship and try to grab their treasure? Flee from another ship to protect your own? Hide your stuff on an island and come back later for it? Get attacked by ghost ships while fighting other players and then a giant mega shark attacks the ghost ship and then you kill the shark, the ghost ship and the players and theres not enough time to loot it all because someone else is approaching? Everything is possible!

Now, the game can be called grindy if you are going to level up ranks in the different companies. But you know what?
This game offers no progression in power-level whatsoever, which I really enjoy. Everything you can earn or grind for is costmetic and therefor entirely optional. No player you encounter will be more powerful then you just because they look more fancy.
So you dont have to grind and can just focus on having fun! Isn´t that great?

I played this game back when it was in open beta and from what little there was to it, it was a blast to play and more so with friends. Fast forward to now and the amount of changes and content added I could only imagine how much better it has gotten. So far I've only done the small "tutorial" island and that alone was enough to tell me how much has actually changed and I'd say for the better.
People are always going to complain about there never being enough content but if you're starting this game fresh or new then there's going to be plenty to do be it exploring, treasure hunting, fighting (PvE), or (PvP) being a pirate and finding people to fight and steal their loot. As usual, a game like this is always better enjoyed with friends but you can sail around solo and have fun too.
At the end of the day, in my opinion, this game will give you more than 40 hours of playtime (1$ = 1 hour (seems fair)) and well worth getting into. The graphics and art style are stunning, the islands, oceans, and other scenery are vibrant and beautiful. The multiple factions give you plenty of things to do and work towards.
If you're looking for a fun, mostly chill game to play either alone or with some friends I'd definitely recommend trying this out.

Don't let my hours fool you, I have hundreds, if not thousands of hours on record on the windows 10 store.

I first bought this game last year, after really enjoying it after playing on the game pass. This is truly a fantastic game, unlike any other.

You can't really compare this game to anything else already out there, you can choose to be more friendly, and mainly do PvE, getting your loot the hard way (which is what I usually end up doing...), or, you could wait for others to do the PvE for you, and then sink their ship and steal their loot.

Yes, this game can feel horrible at times, when you have a bunch of loot on board and you get sunk, frankly, it sucks. But, the fantastic experiences this game provides are well worth it. I thoroughly recommend doing the base tall tales, they are amazing. The last tall tale is quite out of the ordinary, and differs a lot from the others. The tall tale grind can get a bit cumbersome if you also try to 100% all of the commendations, but it is well worth it, don't give up, get to tall tale 9.

Thanks for reading, if you read this far, just buy it, It's a fantastic game, and Rare really has provided us with a truly unique experience. Check my screenshots if you want to see some of the fantastic sights in the game!

Sea of thieves is an open world sandbox game where everything is open to you. It is not a game in which holds your hand and tells you where to go. The decision to go travel is on you. Sail to a new islands and see what happens along your way and who you run into. This game since it's release has had a ton of things added to it and will give you hours of enjoyment as long as you understand that YOU make the journey and not the game. 

TALL TALES:

Want to learn a bit about the lore, concept, and purpose behind he world? Well start doing a tall tale. These are small missions that take you on a story about the world. Not only that you get some cosmetics when you manage to finish them off. There are a ton of Tall Tales each of their own variety and will give you a new feeling every time you do another one. Take the time to learn about the world and why it is as it is.

ENCOUNTERS:

Throughout the SOT world you will experience vast encounters, from Megalodon's, to Kraken's to Skeleton ships and to even real player ships. There are a ton of things to do in the game and a ton of encounters to experience. Take each one of them and face it head on. Don't be scared for a challenge.

EVENTS:

Forts, Skeleton Fleets, Reapers Chests and more. There are events always happening in SOT and it's on you to finish them off and reap the glory they give.

EMISSARY:

Want to prove you are #1 in the world? Well then take on the Emissary missions and grind some rep for your company. The leader board will showcase the top players in the world for that Emissary. Do you think you can get to #1? 

All in all Sea of Thieves is a open world Sandbox game. You can do whatever you want, where ever you want and that's the concept you need to take along with you. It's not a game that will always tell you where to go. Unless you're doing a mission in which it will direct you to an island. But otherwise it is open. Explore, discover and overall enjoy what the game has to offer you and more.
If you want to learn more about the game. Feel free to visit my Youtube channel where I discuss some aspects of the game in hopes that you learn a bit about the world and how to play.
This is my Newest Video explaining how to Sloop: https://youtu.be/ccO4Gdy9fXw

I might add from the start that I bought this game through the Microsoft Store when the game was released so my total playtime is much higher.

How to start? Well this is a game with a bit of a troubled launch to say the least. While a functional game it was really barebones. A big world with nothing really in it besides the same 3 missions over and over again.
But how is the game now at it's Steam release?
Well it is in a much better state without a doubt. From skeleton ships that can show up and mess with you to a bigger map with more natural hazards. Add to this with 1 more faction added that you can earn reputation for to more weapons and items, quests and a new ship. So there is more to do with still with room to expand even further.

Graphics are still top-notch with it's stylized look in their characters giving it it's own rather unique look to the gorgeous scenery and water with great sounds to accompany it.

Sailing which will take up most of your playtime isn't hardcore or complex but it isn't totally shallow either. You need to keep a watch on the wind and raise and lower the sail(sails depending on ship) and angle them as well in order to get the most out of the wind. And yet the sailing is easily the most enjoyable aspect of the game with the ships behaving well with the water and waves rocking the boat in a realistic manner. Getting caught in a storm can be quite a challenge just trying to keep a steady course and preventing the ship from getting flooded. Beware if you got a weak stomach since sea sickness is a possiblity.

Combat is as basic as it gets but it works. Same with enemies where you are either fighting skeletons, snakes or other players. But there is some variation when it comes to the skeletons like with some golden skeletons being very hard to kill to shadow skeletons that can only be hurt when in the light.

Naturally the game isn't perfect(few are). Main being is that it might not be totally fun if you are a solo player. With 3 ships available, there is really only 1 ship for solo players since the other 2 ships are too big to be handled by 1 person. And it's always more fun to play with others. Thankfully there is a matchmaking service so anyone sailing with a open crew slot you can join in.

Expansions are released free of charge and the game has microtransactions but it's for cosmetics only and most cosmetics you can unlock by simply playing the game.

Overall I recommend this game.

Sea of Thieves is one of the best multiplayer coop experience you can currently get. It highly depends of your crew, you and up to your 3 friends can join to have your own adventure. The beauty of this game is that it does not have any progress in developing your character. At first it may seems pretty repetitive and boring. There is no way to make your ship stronger, or character do more damage. This makes every encounter on the seas challenging. The only progress that you can make is by knowing the core mechanics better, and use them to your advantage. By smart managing your ship and using all variety of different cannonballs it is deffinietly possible to sink a 4 person galleon while flying 2 person sloop. The only things that you can buy for money are clothes and different skins to your weapons and equipment, but you won’t gets any benefits by using endgame and rare varieties of this skins. You can look whatever you like fitting in many different sets of clothes not losing any stats. Game had a pretty rough start in 2018 by a lack of content but now Rare took a good care of their masterpiece by adding regularly new content and even new core mechanics such as fire. Rare is one of the most transparent and connected to community companies I’ve ever seen. They love their game and care about community. The updates are well thought and makes changes that make me go back every time the new update is released. However this is not game for everyone. Its mainly for people that have lots of free time to spare. Quick in-and-out voyages can become a long hours of traveling thru seas collenting more and more loot just to the point that other crew will decide to attack you and steal all the loot. Yes this game is PVP ONLY. That doesn’t necessarily means that everyday you would find someone so desperate to kill you, that he will chase you thru all map and eventually get you in confrontation. BUT loosing your hard earned progress just few minutes away from outpost in with u would cash in your loot is a part of game. I literally have a THIEV word in the title so by setting sail be sure that you will eventually lose many thousands cash by other players. It is in my opinion a great test whether you really like this game. If you would sail for like a 4/5 hours on duo sloop with your friend just to be downed by a galleon of reapers bones, and after a break to chill after this loss you would still want to play and maybe make up what your lost. It is definitely a game that I would recommend with all my heart. After 1.5 year, couple hundred hours, and millions in cash stolen from me I am still waiting with a smile on my face to buy this game second time, just to have an hour counter. I love the aesthetics, unique climate, developers and every part (except double gunning) of this masterpiece. I you are not sure just buy a 1 dollar trial on xbox game pass with your buddies and give it a shot like I did in march 2019. Trust me you won’t regret.
